required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Study of LCAR-C182A Cells in the Treatment of Advanced Gastric Cancer and Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-Label Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of LCAR-C182A, an Anti-Claudin18.2 CAR-T Cell Therapy in Patients With Advanced Gastric Cancer and Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open label, single center, single arm phase 1 study to evaluate the safety , tolerability, pharmacokinetics and efficacy and immunogenicity of LCAR-C182A cells targeting Claudin18.2 in the treatment of patients with advanced gastric cancer and Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma.

clinical_study.why_stopped: the Preliminary data, progress of this study and the adjustment of the pipeline and strategy .

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any untoward medical event that occurs in a participant administered an investigational product,and it does not necessarily indicate only events with clear causal relationship with the relevant investigational product.
Maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D)

primary_outcome.measure: Transgene Levels of LCAR-C182A CAR-T Cells
primary_outcome.description: Transgene Levels of LCAR-C182A CAR-T Cells using sensitive assay methods will be assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Chimeric Antigen Receptor T (CAR-T) Positive Cell Concentration
primary_outcome.description: Venous blood samples will be collected for measurement of CAR-T positive cellular concentration
Serum cytokine concentrations such as IL-2, IL-6, IL-8, 1L-10, TNF-α, IFN-γ will be measured for biomarker assessment

secondary_outcome.description: The ORR is defined as the proportion of patients with complete or partial response according to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors（RECIST) criteria.

The DOR is defined as the time between the initial onset of complete or partial remission and the onset of disease progression in patients with objective remission according to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors（RECIST) criteria.
The PFS is defined as the Time from enrollment until disease progression or death according to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors（RECIST) criteria.
The OS is defined as Time from enrollment until death from any cause according to Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors（RECIST) criteria.

intervention.description: Patients receive fludarabine (3×300 mg/ m^2) and cyclophosphamide (3×30 mg/m^2) IV on days -5 to-3, and then Patients receive CAR-T cells. PS：The specific dose of fludarabine and cyclophosphamide is adjusted according to the individual condition of the subject and the judgment of the investigator.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xian Jiaotong University
